post_text: Bronzeville Academy was happy to be the distribution site over the weekend for food and supply distribution during the Covid-19 crisis. Stay safe and help your fellow man, people!!!
shared_text:
Todd Belcore
May 2 at 1:36 PM ·

7,502 pounds.

Yes, seven *thousand*, five hundred and two pounds.

That’s how much food was distributed this weekend as part of Social Change’s response to the immense need created by this crisis.

This is the sort of work supported by our fundraising campaign that ends next week.

Next week next week. Lol

Have you given or shared our fundraiser yet? 🙂

Every cent and every share matters.

If you can, take a moment to give and/or spread the word today (link below)!

http://bit.ly/SocialChangesCovidResponse

Huge shout out to:
- Ashley, Burleson, Derek, LaCroix and Jordan at Tyson Foods
- Bronzeville Academy Charter School CEO Alvin Boutte
- SaveMoneySaveLife’s ED Laundi Germaine Keepseagle, Troy, Steven & their entire team
- Dns Cargo, Inc & Aaron Haroon Garel
for helping to make it all possible!

Also, a thanks go to State Senator Mattie Hunter & Representative Lamont J Robinson for coming out and serving! 🙏🏽

Bronzeville Academy families we are attempting to deliver food supplies to all of you via our school meal provider, Gourmet Gorilla. Please note if you have a call or text from a number you don’t recognize in the morning it may be them. Again Gourmet Gorilla is the school meal provider and normally travels in new model white service vans. Any questions please inbox the school here on FB.
Stay staff and remember wash your hand and all fruits and vegetables!!!!

Sincerely,
Mr. Boutte
CEO

post_text:
Bronzeville Academy Charter School will be closed Tuesday, March 17, 2020 in accord with directives given by Governor Pritzker and the Illinois State Board of Education. As of now, school will resume on Tuesday, March 31, 2020. Take home school work and pertinent information will be distributed at school on Monday, March 16, 2020.
Thank you for your continued understanding and cooperation. Please do your best to keep your kids home and healthy. Take home meals will be available for pickup at the school.

Sincerely,
Alvin Boutte
CEO

and
Simcha Dixon
Principal
text:
Bronzeville Academy Charter School will be closed Tuesday, March 17, 2020 in accord with directives given by Governor Pritzker and the Illinois State Board of Education. As of now, school will resume on Tuesday, March 31, 2020. Take home school work and pertinent information will be distributed at school on Monday, March 16, 2020.
Thank you for your continued understanding and cooperation. Please do your best to keep your kids home and healthy. Take home meals will be available for pickup at the school.

Sincerely,
Alvin Boutte
CEO

and
Simcha Dixon
Principal

post_text:
Welcome back Bronzeville Academy families and welcome to our new families. This is going to be a special year as we’re growing and exploring every way to help our students grow. We took a lot of time over the summer improving the campus and our offerings for your children. We’re all excited to finally start the year and build our future leaders.

If you have any questions feel free to IM us here or email at info@BACSK8.org. We respond immediately and value all of your input.

Regards,
Alvin Boutte
CEO
text:
Welcome back Bronzeville Academy families and welcome to our new families. This is going to be a special year as we’re growing and exploring every way to help our students grow. We took a lot of time over the summer improving the campus and our offerings for your children. We’re all excited to finally start the year and build our future leaders.

If you have any questions feel free to IM us here or email at info@BACSK8.org. We respond immediately and value all of your input.

Regards,
Alvin Boutte

post_text: BACS will be at the INCS job fair. Will you?
shared_text:
EVENTBRITE.COM
INCS Teacher & Administrator Job Fair

Illinois Network of Charter Schools
March 23, 2019 at 8:44 AM ·

Have you registered for the Illinois Network of Charter Schools’ Teacher & Administrator Job Fair yet? Don’t delay—the event is two weeks away!

post_text: Thanks for visiting with us today. We learned a lot.
shared_text:
Commissioner Kari K. Steele is feeling inspired at Brownsville Academy Charter School.
February 27, 2019 at 2:21 PM · Chicago, IL ·

A busy day as Metropolitan Water Reclamation District of Greater Chicago (MWRD) President often includes making time to meet inspiring students to teach them about the fascinating work at the MWRD. Today’s visit with 5th through 8th graders for Career Day at Bronzeville Academy Charter School was a good introduction to STEM opportunities and sharing how we treat waste water. Thank you Principal Kenebrew and staff for sharing your students with me. #peacelovecleanwater ✌️❤️💧 #stem #chemist #waterconservationtips Commissioner Kari Steele
text:
Thanks for visiting with us today. We learned a lot.

Ambassador Braun spoke to the students and staff of Bronzeville Academy about her time as the first African American US Senator since Reconstruction and her time as US Ambassador to New Zealand.
